data.title: Duel : shoot first !
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

wantedList = {}

n = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    inputs = input().split(' ')
    speed = int(inputs[-1])
    desperado = (' ').join(inputs[:-1])
    if speed >= 0:
        wantedList[speed] = desperado

# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)
if n != 0 and len(wantedList) > 0:
    answer = sorted(wantedList.items(), key=lambda t: t[0])

    [print(a[1]) for a in answer]
else:
    print("NONE")
data.statement:
You are one of the fastest sheriffs in the West. You've taken responsibility for a wagon loaded with gold bullion, now ruthless bands of desperados are vying to shoot you down and lighten the wagon of it's precious load. This is the ultimate chance to prove your skills and be the best - second place is underground! 

You will face many opponents, some are slow, other are fast. You have to deal with the fastest ones first! You know their firing speed. Good luck sheriff, stop these desperados!

testCases.title: First ambush
testCases.testIn:
3
Joe Dalton 50
Calamity Jane 30
Billy The Kid 60
testCases.testOut:
Calamity Jane
Joe Dalton
Billy The Kid

testCases.title: Faster than his shadow
testCases.testIn:
4
Butch Cassidy 5
Emmett Dalton 50
Lucky Luke -10
Jesse James 200
testCases.testOut:
Butch Cassidy
Emmett Dalton
Jesse James

testCases.title: The good, the bad and you

data.constraints:
0 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10
All bandits have different fire speed.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read desperado:string(100)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<First line:>> [[N]], the number of desperados.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> [[Name]] and [[firing speed]] in milliseconds.
data.outputDescription:
[[Names]] of desperados. Ordered by shooting speed. The fastest is the first.
If the speed is under zero, do not include this person in the final list. You cannot kill a legend.

{{NONE}} if there is nobody.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are one of the fastest sheriffs in the West. You've taken responsibility for a wagon loaded with gold bullion, now ruthless bands of desperados are vying to shoot you down and lighten the wagon of it's precious load. This is the ultimate chance to prove your skills and be the best - second place is underground!

You will face many opponents, some are slow, other are fast. You have to deal with the fastest ones first! You know their firing speed. Good luck sheriff, stop these desperados!
Input
First line: N, the number of desperados.
Next N lines: Name and firing speed in milliseconds.
Output
Names of desperados. Ordered by shooting speed. The fastest is the first.
If the speed is under zero, do not include this person in the final list. You cannot kill a legend.

NONE if there is nobody.
Constraints
0 ≤ N ≤ 10
All bandits have different fire speed.
Example
Input
3
Joe Dalton 50
Calamity Jane 30
Billy The Kid 60
Output
Calamity Jane
Joe Dalton
Billy The Kid
